skillTree.localised_description: A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.

skillTree.localised_description: The Emperor has oft ridden a majestic Imperial pegasus in battle.

skillTree.localised_description: The bond between Franz and Deathclaw - the mightiest of Imperial Griffons - is legendary.
Franz is a sterling leader beloved by many, who can inspire not just those close, but all men.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -15% for Reiksguard and Greatswords units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: "If we die, we will die wielding our swords, for there is no better death for a warrior."

effects.description:
[HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: Karl Franz has been hailed as an innovative tactician and a valiant general. Only the bravest and best among the Reiksguard may fight at his side.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +8 for Reiksguard units
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs Large: +8 for Reiksguard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Followers of the Emperor are inspired by his presence to attain levels of excellence in swordsmanship and personal loyalty they never thought possible.
"We will sit at Sigmar's banquet like the heroes of old and our names will be remembered in our people's songs until the end of time!"

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +4 for Empire Captains
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Thanks to Karl Franz's tireless efforts on behalf of his people, the Empire has flourished during his reign as never before.
Although Karl Franz walks a path many have trodden before, few - if any - have done so with such perfection and grace.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
This one will not go down easily - it will be necessary to break both the will and the body first.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

factionEffects.localised_description: The newly-elected Emperor is Karl Franz, Prince of Altdorf and Elector Count of Reikland. Franz is already garnering a reputation as a great statesman and warrior but has yet to prove himself as sovereign.

items.colour_text: One of twelve magical swords belonging to the Empire's Elector Counts, 'Beast Slayer' has taken down many of the hideous monsters infesting the dark, dense Drakwald Forest.
Created by the warrior mage, Fredrik von Tarnus, the Silver Seal wards away harmful blows and fell sorceries.
